meanings.definition: Bargained or haggled over the price of something.
meanings.sent1: She chaffered with the vendor to get a better deal on the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: The customers chaffered with the salesperson before finally agreeing on a price.
meanings.sent3: The children chaffered playfully over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The politicians chaffered for hours, trying to reach a compromise on the new law.
meanings.sent5: The old friends chaffered back and forth, reminiscing about the good old days.

meanings.definition: Engaged in negotiations or discussions, especially over a price.
meanings.sent1: The chaffered couple finally settled on a price for the house.
meanings.sent2: The chaffered deal was reached after much back-and-forth discussion.
meanings.sent3: The chaffered neighbors debated loudly about the property line.
meanings.sent4: The chaffered decision left everyone satisfied with the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The chaffered agreement was fair to both parties involved.

meanings.definition: Exchanged goods or services through negotiation.
meanings.sent1: The chaffered trade between the two countries benefited both economies.
meanings.sent2: The chaffered exchange of goods was a win-win situation for the businesses.
meanings.sent3: The chaffered barter system allowed for a fair distribution of resources.
meanings.sent4: The chaffered transaction was completed smoothly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The chaffered swap of services helped both parties save money.
